page.title: 04PARISH COUNCIL (2)
page.content: It is frequently the body expected to take a lead within the community on projects for the benefit of the community, but is not necessarily expected to carry out the project itself but to give a lead in bringing people together for the purpose.This is a natural role as often the Parish Council is the only body with initial access to information and with the resources to take on initiative. A Parish Council has the power to report to other authorities for the repairs of roads, footpaths, street lights etc: and the power to provide seats or shelters or flowers, trees providing they are not on private land. War Memorials, Church Clocks and cemeteries can also come under the powers of a Parish Council.
